snippet: A woman named Reshma was found gasping but alive in the wreckage of a garment building, and the reaction in Bangladesh was euphoric.
abstract: Rescuers discover female garment worker named Reshma, alive nearly 17 full days after Rana Plaza building collapse in Bangladesh; her rescue offers a temporary respite from the gloom and a startling tale of resilience; she survived in 10 feet by 8 feet opening, high enough for her to stand, within a penumbra of collapsed beams and pillars; reaction in Bangladesh is euphoric.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Jim Yardley from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: A woman named Reshma was found gasping but alive in the wreckage of a garment building, and the reaction in Bangladesh was euphoric.

headline.seo: Woman Rescued in Bangladesh Rubble 17 Days After Collapse
headline.main: 17 Days in Darkness, a Cry of ‘Save Me,’ and Joy
headline.print_headline: 17 Days in Darkness, a Cry of ‘Save Me,’ and Joy
